title: NSE board to meet on February 6 to constitute IPO panel
description: The National Stock Exchange board will meet on February 6 to begin its initial public offering process. This follows regulatory clearance from Sebi. A special committee will be formed to oversee the listing. The exchange's financial results will also be reviewed. This marks a significant step after a decade of delays.

analysis.summary: NSE board plans IPO process following regulatory clearance; review of financial results and special committee formation.

title: Sebi modifies Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic trading. Key changes explained
description: Sebi is refining its Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic orders, effective April 6, 2026. New exemptions for equity options and specific price bands aim to balance market liquidity with preventing excessive order placement. These changes follow stakeholder input and acknowledge the role of market makers. Separately, Sebi proposed overhauling its 'fit and proper person' rules for intermediaries.

analysis.company: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi)
analysis.summary: April 6 adjustments to order-to-trade ratios for algo orders, focusing on liquidity and excessive placements. Stakeholder feedback acknowledged market makers' roles.

title: Devyani International Q3 Results: Loss widens to Rs 109 crore, revenue up 11%
description: Devyani International Ltd announced a net loss of Rs 109.78 crore for the December quarter of FY26. This marks an increase from the previous year's loss. However, the company saw its revenue from operations rise by 11.31 percent. Its Biryani by Kilo business reached breakeven. Devyani International is a major franchisee for KFC and Pizza Hut in India.

analysis.sentiment: Mixed - Negative on profit but Positive on revenue growth and breakeven in a segment.
analysis.impact: Bullish towards sectors related to Devyani'th operations due to the overall increase in revenues, despite not-so-rosy profits.
analysis.summary: Devyani International Ltd reported an Rs 109.78 crore net loss for Q3 FY26 but saw a positive revenue growth of 11.31 percent and breakeven in Biryani by Kilo business.

title: Indian bonds rise ahead of RBI debt purchase, policy outcome
description: Indian government bonds rose for a second straight session as expectations of continued RBI bond purchases supported sentiment ahead of record FY27 borrowing. The 10-year yield eased to 6.6972%, while markets await the RBI’s policy decision and liquidity outlook. Traders expect no further rate cuts but continued growth-supportive OMO operations.

analysis.summary: Indian government bonds rose on prospect of sustained RBI purchases ahead of record FY27 borrowing.

title: Carlsberg shares rise on profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
description: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

analysis.summary: Exceeding profit forecasts with a rise in full-year operating profits; considering an IPO for Indian operations to reduce debt.

title: Carlsberg shares rise as profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
description: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

analysis.summary: Exceeded profit forecasts with a rise in operating profit; exploring Indian IPO for debt reduction.

title: India is the largest private equity destination for us outside the US: Chip Kaye, chairman, Warburg Pincus
description: Kaye and Jeffrey Perlman, the firm’s CEO, along with other senior management, are in India to celebrate their 30-year investing journey. Starting with backing entrepreneurs and businesses such as Sunil Mittal, HDFC, IDFC, among others, the firm has, over the last three decades, backed 80 companies.

title: Pizza Hut reset in focus as Devyani International appoints new CEO
description: Manish Dawar, the incoming president and chief executive, said Devyani International will add zero net new Pizza Hut outlets in 2026, shifting attention instead to fixing the fundamentals.

analysis.sentiment: Negative | Neutral | Positive (Based on personal interpretation of news affecting stock)
analysis.impact: Bearish | Bullish | Neutral (Depends on the broader market reaction and company's historical performance in similar situations)
analysis.summary: Devyani International appoints new CEO with a focus shift to improving Pizza Hut fundamentals instead of expanding outlets.

title: Today, the AI story is not well understood in the Indian market: Fractal CEO
description: There's a huge need to just educate the market on AI because there are not a lot of AI stocks out there, says Fractal Analytics' founder Srikanth Velamakanni.

title: IndiGo reduces Manchester, London flights, to suspend Copenhagen services - check schedule here
description: IndiGo, in a statement released on Wednesday, announced the revised schedule for its long-haul flights, trimming services on Copenhagen, Manchester and London sectors. Here's the full revised schedule.

title: Byju’s resolution professional aims at Raveendran Singapore firm in Aakash control battle
description: As Byju's navigates a bankruptcy resolution, the spotlight is back on Beeaar, a Singapore firm owned by promoter Byju Raveendran. The resolution professional has alleged Beeaar's directors acted in a way that shareholder structures and covenants in Aakash Educational Services were violated.

analysis.summary: Resolution professional alleges Byeair directors breached shareholder covenants and structures during Aakash Educational Services' bankruptcy.

title: Here's how the top H-1B sponsor is turning to India as Trump tightens visa rules
description: The expansion plan comes amid tighter US immigration policies under Donald Trump. In January this year, Washington announced an indefinite pause on immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries.

analysis.summary: A leading tech company's expansion plan amidst US policy changes.

title: Josh D'Amaro to get $45 million in first year as Disney CEO, but there's more
description: Disney has fixed D'Amaro's annual base salary at $2.5 million, and he will receive a long-term incentive award with a target value of $26.3 million each fiscal year.

analysis.summary: Josh D'Amaro appointed as Disney CEO; base salary and incentive aligned with performance
